intro: Lepidium coronopifolium f. orbiculatum, commonly known as the orbiculate peppergrass, is a rare and distinctive variant of the peppergrass species. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, orbicular (rounded) leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in dense, branched inflorescences. This subspecies is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas.
